title: Find the Right Eosinophilic Esophagitis Specialist for You

content: Your primary care doctor may recommend that you see a specialist for eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE). You may work with an allergist , a gastroenterologist, or both. It’s important to find a specialist who you can work closely with. Your doctor will keep you updated on how your EoE is doing, tell you when you need more tests, and help you make the right lifestyle changes.

sections.heading: Do I Need an Allergist or a Gastroenterologist?
content: You may need to manage EoE with a variety of strategies. Different specialists can help you with different aspects of EoE. A gastroenterologist is a doctor who’s trained in conditions that involve your esophagus, stomach, gallbladder , pancreas, bile ducts, small intestine, and colon. Your gastroenterologist may also specialize in motility disorders, which focus on how your digestive system manages food, liquid, and waste. Your gastroenterologist will tell you when you need tests, like endoscopies, to see if your EoE has gotten better or worse. They’ll also share advice on how to manage EoE, including foods you may need to stay away from.

content: An allergist is a doctor who’s trained in treating asthma and other allergic diseases. They’ll check to see if allergies are playing a role in your EoE. Your allergist can tell you which foods or other things to avoid. They may create a diet plan for you. They may also treat allergic conditions you have, like asthma, allergic rhinitis, or eczema . Your gastroenterologist and your allergist will work together to help you manage EoE. They should be on the same page, so it’s important that they talk to each other and agree on the right approach.

sections.heading: How Do I Find a Doctor?
content: The first step is to gather names of doctors. Ask your primary care doctor if they have a specialist who they’ve worked with and who they trust. Ask people you trust for recommendations. This may include friends, family members, neighbors, and co-workers. You can also go through your insurance company to find doctors who are covered by your plan. Call or go online to find a list of doctors in your area that accept your insurance.

sections.heading: How Do I Know If They’re a Good Fit?
content: Do some research on each doctor you’re considering. Look online for their doctor’s profile. Find out about their education and training. Where did the doctor go to school? What’s their highest level of training and education? You can also review their professional interests. If you’re looking for a doctor who specializes in motility studies, they may list it in their interests section. The more experience a doctor has, the better your care may be. Find out if your doctor lists EoE as one of their specialties. Look for specialized tests or surgeries they’ve done to treat EoE and how many people they’ve treated for the condition. You can also call the doctor’s office to find out about their specialties and experience. Ask the office staff for details on their training and experience with EoE.

sections.heading: Check Your Insurance Coverage
content: Your costs may vary based on whether a doctor is covered by your insurance plan.

content_blocks.text: Your costs may vary based on whether a doctor is covered by your insurance plan.

content: Call your insurance company to see what’s covered under your plan. Ask what’s paid for and what’s not. Find out what you can do to lower your out-of-pocket expenses. Check to see if the doctor is in-network or out-of-network. If the doctor is out-of-network, ask if your plan lets you choose an out-of-network doctor, and if so, how the costs differ. Next, call the doctor’s office. Double-check that they accept your insurance plan. You can also ask if they offer financial assistance and what you can do to lower your out-of-pocket expenses.

sections.heading: Look for Someone You Can Talk To
content: It’s best to find someone who you can trust and talk openly with. Get a feel for how the doctor works with other people who have similar needs to you. Look for a doctor who: Spends enough time with you Explains things clearly Makes sure you understand what they’re saying Asks questions Is interested in your opinions Wants to know what you’re worried about Listens to you You may prefer a doctor with a certain gender, race, or ethnic background. You can find this information on their online profile or by calling the doctor’s office and asking someone on staff.

sections.heading: Get Details on the Doctor’s Practice and Availability
content: Look for a specialist who’s easy to see. This may mean they’re close to where you live or work. It may also mean their schedule isn’t overbooked. Go online or call the doctor’s office to find out: What languages they speak Where they’re located If they’re taking new patients If they belong to a group practice, and if so, which other doctors might you see Which hospital the doctor works with When appointments are available and if they’re available on weekends or weeknights
